Class HumanPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • HardPlayer
      • HumanPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Player

    public class HumanPlayer
extends HardPlayer
    A class that implements Player (via HardPlayer), but is controlled by the human. This acts as an interface between simulator and the humans It is an extension of HardPlayer so that it can call the HardPlayer to get hints.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HumanPlayer()
      A constructor for human player.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • HumanPlayer

        public HumanPlayer()
        A constructor for human player. This sets the next move as no move being made.

    • Method Detail

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove(int column)
        The function that will get called by the UI when a move has been made by the human

        pre: the given column is within the range of the current board
        post: nextMove has been set as the given input within the humanplayer class

        Parameters:
        column: - an integer between 0 and the board width that represents the column of the next move

      • hintMove

        public int hintMove(Board current)
        Used to get hints from the super class HardAI. Will be called by the UI.

        pre: none
        post: the suggested move has been returned

        Parameters:
        current: - the current board, this is required to conform the HumanPlayer to the Player interface.
        Returns:
        the number of the column of the move

      • nextMove

        public int nextMove(Board current)
        The function responsible for checking if a move has been made, this will be called by the simulator.

        pre: none
        post: either the new move has been returned and nextMove has been set back to NO_MOVE, or NO_MOVE has been returned and no change is made to nextMove

        Specified by:
        nextMove in interface Player
        Overrides:
        nextMove in class HardPlayer
        Parameters:
        current: - the current board, this is required to conform the HumanPlayer to the Player interface but is not actually used.
        Returns:
        -1 if no move has been made yet or the number of the column of the move
